answers.answer: I believe elevated blood sugar is a possible side effect, but all you can do is have your doctor monitor your blood sugar closely, as I am sure he will want to do for you.  Healthy diet and exercise is recommended for everyone to help ward off diabetes, and especially for those with a family history -- even without taking the Abilify into consideration.  I hope it works well for you.BTW - be careful with the lamictal, which I am also taking -- my doc says to watch out for a rash which can be very serious.Hugs,Ruby

I'm on Abilify too and my pdoc said that it is a blanketed warning required by the FDA because another medication in that class caused a few pre-market study participants to have raised blood sugar levels. He said it's not anything to worry about. question: My doc put me on abilify yesterday and warned me that it can cause serious blood sugar problems.  This scares me because I have a family history of diabetes.  Can a healthier diet and excercise plan help offset this possible side effect, or does it just happen anyway, no matter what your diet?  Also, is there any other things I need to be warned about or watch for while I start this new medication?  I am already taking lamictal as well.
title: Abilify-Can diet help prevent side effects?
